goal.ch: 瞭解太陽系的基本構造和普查各行星、衛星及小物體的來源、演化和物理性質。

outline.en: “Course Description: Topics to be covered include:1. Overviews of our solar system and extra-solar systems;2. Gravity: Kepler’s laws and Newton’s laws; planetary orbits; tides and tidal heating; planetary rings;3. Energy and matter: conservation of energy, equation of state, phase transitions;4. Light and radiation: emission and absorption of radiation, spectra, blackbody radiation, Doppler shift, wavelength, frequency, radio waves, infrared, x-rays and gamma-rays;5. Origins: formation of the sun and the solar system, Jeans collapse of molecular cloud, the early solar nebula, condensation and accretion, protoplanetary disks, formation of terrestrial and giant planets, formation of comets and asteroids, formation of planetary moons;6. Planetary geology (Mercury, Venus, Mars and the Moon): planetary interiors, shapes and surface structures, comparison of terrestrial planets;7. Planetary atmospheres (Mercury, Venus, Mars and the Moon): atmospheric structures, planetary magnetospheres, atmospheric origins and evolutionary histories;8. The giant planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune): interiors, atmospheres, satellites and rings of the giant planets: the Galilean satellites,Titan and Enceladus, Triton, irregular satellites, and the ring systems;9. Asteroids, comets and dwarf planets: orbital distributions, taxonomy of asteroids, dynamical origins of comets, outgassing activity of comets;10. Meteorites: classification and origins, meteorites-asteroids relation;11. Deep impacts: historical and observational records of Deep Impacts, impacts and mass extinctions on Earth, threats of near-Earth objects;12. Exoplanets: hot Jupiters, super-Earths, the habitable zones, astrobiology.“

gradMethod.ch: “Exams: There will be one mid-term exam and one final exam. About half of the questions will be conceptual essay questions, and the other half computational problems. Exams will constitute 40％ of the final grade.“
